column4: hi all, anyone can help me?    exact error that occured. This usually means GTK+ is incorrectly installed.
configure: error: GTK+ 2.4 or later isn't available, so Wireshark can't be compiled
I think you need to install the "libgtk2.0-dev" package
error: Header file pcap.h not found; if you installed libpcap
from source, did you also do "make install-incl", and if you installed a
binary package of libpcap, is there also a developer's package of libpcap,
and did you also install that package?
did you try installing the "libpcap-dev" package ?
why did't you simply install the version from the repositories, ie "sudo apt-get install wireshark" ?
should still be easier to install from repos...
ha, libpcap-dev worked, wireshark has installed, thanks. :)
